properties.areaDesc: Franklin; Wake; Vance; Durham; Nash; Granville
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 2:53AM EST by NWS Raleigh NC
properties.description:
At 252 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and
strong thunderstorms over Raleigh and Falls Lake, moving northeast
at 50 mph.

Wind gusts up to 45 mph will be possible with this storm. In
addition, heavy rain with rainfall rates in excess of a half inch
per hour and minor flooding will also be possible with these showers
and thunderstorms.

Locations impacted include...
Raleigh, Cary, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Garner, Zebulon,
Franklinton, Kittrell and Bunn.
properties.instruction:
Seek shelter in a nearby building or vehicle. Wind gusts as high as
40 mph are capable of knocking down tree limbs and blowing around
trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture and other light outdoor
objects.

Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in
ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and
minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage.
Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid
hydroplaning, especially in urban areas where prolonged heavy rain
can quickly lead to flooding.

NWSheadline: AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TRIANGLE AREA INCLUDING NORTHWESTERN NASH...SOUTHWESTERN VANCE...SOUTHERN GRANVILLE...WAKE... SOUTHEASTERN DURHAM AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES UNTIL 345 AM EST
